definition: to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: To count the blessings in life , believing abundance abounds.
sentences.chinese: 数念生命中的恩赐，相信富足无处不在。

sentences.english: To count the blessings in life, believing abundance abounds.
sentences.chinese: 数念生命中的恩赐，相信富足是无处不有。

sentences.english: i wish you many more anniversaries each happier than the last.
sentences.chinese: 愿你们有更多周年数念日，一年比一年更幸福。

definition: to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud
to feel anxious about sth/unable to stop thinking about sth/to miss
to stare at angrily/variant of 嗔[chen1]
ancient (esp. pre-Qin) pronunciation of a Chinese character/classical speech sounds
